required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Safety and Effectiveness of Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix in the Treatment of Deep Burn Skin Injuries
clinical_study.official_title: A Traditional Feasibility Study to Assess the Safety and Effectiveness of the Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) in the Treatment of Deep Burn Skin Injuries.

collaborator.agency: Department of Health and Human Services
Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, single arm, traditional feasibility study to allow a preliminary assessment of the safety and effectiveness of a new method of treating skin burns using Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-center, single arm, traditional feasibility study to allow a preliminary assessment of the safety and effectiveness of BTM treatment. Patients with 10-70% TBSA burns will have BTM devices implanted in areas with deep partial or full thickness burns to treat at least 5% TBSA.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of application of split skin graft (SSG) (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of total body surface area (%TBSA) of BTM that has adhered at time of skin grafting, divided by the %TBSA treated with BTM, then multiplied by 100 to express as a percentage. Calculated per study lesion and averaged per participant.

The amount (calculated as a percentage) of split skin graft (SSG) that 'takes' expressed as a proportion of SSG applied at 7-10 days after application of SSG. Calculated per study lesion and averaged for each participant.

primary_outcome.time_frame: All timepoints until 12 months after application of SSG
primary_outcome.description: Number and type of Adverse Events occurring after BTM implantation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of application (Day 0) until 12 months after SSG.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of infections in BTM-treated areas, and the success of treatment of local infections with BTM in place. Results will be combined and expressed as local infection rate and response rate to treatment.
Clinical assessment of wound closure expressed as a percentage, per anatomical region
Clinical assessment of wound closure expressed as a percentage, per anatomical region
Clinical assessment of wound closure expressed as a percentage, per anatomical region
Clinical assessment of wound closure expressed as a percentage, per anatomical region
Clinical assessment of wound closure expressed as a percentage, per anatomical region

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Use: "BTM is Easy to Use"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of application of SSG (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Operator ease of use as determined by physician survey, scored on a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 = strongly agree and 5 = strongly disagree. A higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Use: "BTM is Easy to Apply"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of application of SSG (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Operator ease of use as determined by physician survey, scored on a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 = strongly agree and 5 = strongly disagree. A higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Use: "BTM is Easy to Delaminate"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of application of SSG (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Operator ease of use as determined by physician survey, scored on a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 = strongly agree and 5 = strongly disagree. A higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Use: "BTM is a Product I Would Use for Other Burn Patients"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of application of SSG (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Operator ease of use as determined by physician survey, scored on a 1 to 5 scale, where 1 = strongly agree and 5 = strongly disagree. A higher score means a worse outcome.

Joint contracture after treatment, assessed by Joint Contracture Severity Scale. Joint Contracture Severity Scale is assessed per anatomical joint and assigned a value from 1 to 3, where 1 = Mild, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe. Results summarized as the number of participants who had at least one joint assessed with a joint contracture of each severity grade. Where more than one joint motion was affected (e.g. knee flexion, knee extension, etc.), the motion with the most severe contracture at a specific timepoint was reported in the summary results.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1, 2, 3, 6 and 12 months after application of SSG
secondary_outcome.description: Scar appearance/quality assessed by the Modified Vancouver Scar Scale (mVSS), which includes 4 individual sub-scale scores of Pigmentation, Vascularity, Pliability, and Height (mm) of burn lesion and a Total of the individual sub-scale scores. Pigmentation: 0=Normal color, 1=Hypopigmentation, 2=Hyperpigmentation, 3=Combination/Mixed Vascularity: 0=Normal, 1=Pink, 2=Red, 3=Purple. Pliability: 0=Normal, 1=Supple, 2=Yielding, 3=Firm, 4=Banding, 5=Contracture. Height (mm): 0=Normal (flat), 1='<2', 2='>2 and <5', 3='>=5' Total: Sum of individual mVSS scores. Minimum total value = 0. Maximum total value = 14. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 months after application of SSG
secondary_outcome.description: Pruritus incidence and severity assessed by Numerical Rating Scale from 0 to 10, where 0 = no itch and 10 = worst itch imaginable. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

intervention.description: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as NovoSorb BTM) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provides written informed consent (directly or via legal representative) prior to any clinical trial procedures being performed.
- Willing to comply with all study procedures and expects to be available for the duration of the study.
- Male and non-pregnant females ≥ 18 years of age and ≤ 70 years of age.
- Patients with deep partial or full thickness burns (between 10% and 70% inclusive of their TBSA).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a known hypersensitivity to polyurethane or silver-containing materials.
- Multiple traumas (significant traumatic injury to a solid organ in addition to skin).
- Presence of a medical condition with a life expectancy of less than 12 months, such as advanced malignancy.
- Presence of a medical condition that might interfere with treatment evaluation; or require a change in therapy including but not limited to, significant immune deficiency, or skin or vascular diseases in the area of the wound.
- Female with known or suspected pregnancy, planned pregnancy, or lactation.
- Has had exposure to any other investigational agent within the last 6 months.
- Has a clinically significant psychiatric illness.
- Has a condition the Investigator believes would interfere with the ability to comply with study instructions, or that might confound the interpretation of the study results or put the subject at undue risk.

overall_official.affiliation: Royal Adelaide Hospital, Adelaide SA 5000, AUSTRALIA

facility.name: Arizona Burn Center at Maricopa Medical Center
University of California Davis Medical Center
University of Tennessee Health Science Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Only participants (or their legally authorized representatives) who provided written informed consent and who met the eligibility criteria were enrolled and had BTM applied to the study lesions. Participants (or their legally authorized representatives) who provided informed consent but who did not meet the eligibility criteria were excluded and did not have BTM applied.

group.title: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix
group.description: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as BTM Dressing) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type
measure.description: The Fitzpatrick skin type describes a way to classify the skin by its reaction to exposure to sunlight. Skin types are based on questions posed to study participants that reflect the color of their eyes, hair, skin and the response of the skin when exposed to the sun. Participants are categorized in a range from Type I to Type VI, with Type I corresponding to light skin and Type VI to dark skin.

measure.title: % Total Body Surface Area (TBSA) affected by deep dermal/full thickness burn injury
measure.units: Percentage of total body surface area

outcome.title: BTM 'Take' Rate
outcome.description: Percentage of total body surface area (%TBSA) of BTM that has adhered at time of skin grafting, divided by the %TBSA treated with BTM, then multiplied by 100 to express as a percentage. Calculated per study lesion and averaged per participant.
outcome.time_frame: At time of application of split skin graft (SSG) (typically 28-35 days after application of BTM, Day 0)

group.title: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM)
group.description: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as NovoSorb BTM) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

measure.title: BTM 'Take' Rate
measure.description: Percentage of total body surface area (%TBSA) of BTM that has adhered at time of skin grafting, divided by the %TBSA treated with BTM, then multiplied by 100 to express as a percentage. Calculated per study lesion and averaged per participant.
measure.units: percentage of BTM take per subject

outcome.title: SSG 'Take' Rate Over BTM
outcome.description: The amount (calculated as a percentage) of split skin graft (SSG) that 'takes' expressed as a proportion of SSG applied at 7-10 days after application of SSG. Calculated per study lesion and averaged for each participant.

These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

measure.title: SSG 'Take' Rate Over BTM
measure.description: The amount (calculated as a percentage) of split skin graft (SSG) that 'takes' expressed as a proportion of SSG applied at 7-10 days after application of SSG. Calculated per study lesion and averaged for each participant.
measure.units: percentage of SSG take per subject

class.title: Any adverse event leading to treatment discontinuation
Any NCI CTCAE Grade 3 or higher adverse event
Any adverse event leading to death

outcome.title: Joint Contracture
outcome.description: Joint contracture after treatment, assessed by Joint Contracture Severity Scale. Joint Contracture Severity Scale is assessed per anatomical joint and assigned a value from 1 to 3, where 1 = Mild, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe. Results summarized as the number of participants who had at least one joint assessed with a joint contracture of each severity grade. Where more than one joint motion was affected (e.g. knee flexion, knee extension, etc.), the motion with the most severe contracture at a specific timepoint was reported in the summary results.

group.title: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM)
group.description: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as NovoSorb BTM) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

measure.title: Joint Contracture
measure.description: Joint contracture after treatment, assessed by Joint Contracture Severity Scale. Joint Contracture Severity Scale is assessed per anatomical joint and assigned a value from 1 to 3, where 1 = Mild, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe. Results summarized as the number of participants who had at least one joint assessed with a joint contracture of each severity grade. Where more than one joint motion was affected (e.g. knee flexion, knee extension, etc.), the motion with the most severe contracture at a specific timepoint was reported in the summary results.

outcome.title: Scar Severity
outcome.description: Scar appearance/quality assessed by the Modified Vancouver Scar Scale (mVSS), which includes 4 individual sub-scale scores of Pigmentation, Vascularity, Pliability, and Height (mm) of burn lesion and a Total of the individual sub-scale scores. Pigmentation: 0=Normal color, 1=Hypopigmentation, 2=Hyperpigmentation, 3=Combination/Mixed Vascularity: 0=Normal, 1=Pink, 2=Red, 3=Purple. Pliability: 0=Normal, 1=Supple, 2=Yielding, 3=Firm, 4=Banding, 5=Contracture. Height (mm): 0=Normal (flat), 1='<2', 2='>2 and <5', 3='>=5' Total: Sum of individual mVSS scores. Minimum total value = 0. Maximum total value = 14. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.
outcome.time_frame: 1, 2, 3, 6 and 12 months after application of SSG

group.title: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM)
group.description: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as NovoSorb BTM) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). Pliability: 0=Normal, 1=Supple, 2=Yielding, 3=Firm, 4=Banding, 5=Contracture. Height (mm): 0=Normal (flat), 1='<2', 2='>2 and <5', 3='>=5' Total: Sum of individual mVSS scores. Minimum total value = 0. Maximum total value = 14. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

outcome.description: Pruritus incidence and severity assessed by Numerical Rating Scale from 0 to 10, where 0 = no itch and 10 = worst itch imaginable. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.
outcome.time_frame: At 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 months after application of SSG

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected over the study period of up to 12 months after application of the split-thickness skin graft.

group.title: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix
group.description: Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix: The Biodegradable Temporizing Matrix (BTM) (also known as BTM Dressing) comprises a completely synthetic, sterile, integrating dermal component (porous biodegradable polyurethane foam) and a temporary epidermal barrier component (a non-biodegradable polyurethane sealing membrane). These layers are adhered with a biodegradable polyurethane bonding layer. BTM will be implanted and fixed into position to close a debrided burn wound. After a period of integration, the sealing membrane is removed and a split skin graft is applied.

event.description: Infected pseudoaneurysm of right femoral artery
Right femoral artery blowout, s/p right femoral artery patch angioplasty with autogenous vein and sartorius muscle flap

event.sub_title: Increased viscosity of upper respiratory secretion

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
